text: PETER an Apostle of JESUS CHRIST, to the strangers that dwell here and there throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia and Bithynia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father unto sanctification of the Spirit, through obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace and peace be multiplied unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: To an inheritance immortal and undefiled, and that withereth not, reserved in heaven for us,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation, which is prepared to be showed in the last time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherein ye rejoice, though now for a season (if need require) ye are in heaviness, through manifold tentations,
speaker: Narrator

text: That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than gold that perisheth (though it be tried with fire) might be found unto your praise, and honor and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom ye have not seen, and yet love him, in whom now, though ye see him not, yet do you believe, and rejoice with [joy] unspeakable and glorious,
speaker: Narrator

text: Receiving the end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the which salvation the Prophets have inquired and searched, which prophesied of the grace that should come unto you,
speaker: Narrator

text: Searching when or what time the Spirit which testified before of Christ which was in them, should declare the sufferings that should come unto Christ, and the glory that should follow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they should minister the things, which are showed unto you by them which have preached unto you the Gospel by the holy Ghost sent down from heaven, the which things the Angels desire to behold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind: be sober, and trust perfectly on that grace that is brought unto you, in the revelation of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: As obedient children, not fashioned yourselves unto the former lusts of your ignorance:
speaker: Narrator

text: But as he which hath called you, is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because it is written, Be ye holy, for I am holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if ye call him Father, which without respect of person judgeth according to every man’s work, pass the time of your dwelling here in fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Knowing that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, as silver and gold, from your vain conversation, received by the traditions of the fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a Lamb undefiled, and without spot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which was ordained before the foundation of the world, but was declared in the last times for your sakes,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which by his means do believe in God that raised him from the dead, and gave him glory, that your faith and hope might be in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit, to love brotherly without feigning, love one another with a pure heart fervently:
speaker: Narrator

text: Being born anew, not of mortal seed, but of immortal, by the word of God, who liveth and endureth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all flesh is as grass, and all the glory of man is as the flower of grass. The grass withereth, and the flower falleth away.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of the Lord endureth forever: and this is the word which is preached among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore, laying aside all maliciousness, and all guile, and dissimulation, and envy, and all evil speaking,
speaker: Narrator

text: As newborn babes desire that sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because ye have tasted that the Lord is bountiful.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom coming as unto a living stone, disallowed of men, but chosen of God and precious,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye also as lively stones, be made a spiritual house, an holy Priesthood to offer up spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore also it is contained in the Scripture, Behold, I put in Zion a chief cornerstone, elect and precious, and he that believeth therein, shall not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto you therefore which believe, it is precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,
speaker: Narrator

text: And a stone to stumble at, and a rock of offence, even to them which stumble at the word, being disobedient, unto the which thing they were even ordained.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye are a chosen generation, a royal Priesthood, an holy nation, a people set at liberty, that ye should show forth the virtues of him that hath called you out of darkness into his marvelous light,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which in time past were not a people, yet are now the people of God: which in time past were not under mercy, but now have obtained mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dearly beloved, I beseech you, as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts which fight against the soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: And have your conversation honest among the Gentiles, that they which speak evil of you as of evil doers, may by your good works which they shall see, glorify God in the day of visitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore submit yourselves unto all manner ordinance of man for the Lord’s sake, whether it be unto the King, as unto the superior,
speaker: Narrator

text: Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent of him, for the punishment of evil doers, and for the praise of them that do well.
speaker: Narrator

text: For so is the will of God, that by well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of the foolish men.
speaker: Narrator

text: As free, and not as having the liberty for a cloak of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor all men: love brotherly fellowship: fear God: honor the King.
speaker: Narrator

text: Servants, be subject to your masters with all fear, not only to the good and courteous, but also to the froward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what praise is it, if when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye take it patiently? but and if when ye do well, ye suffer wrong and take it patiently, this is acceptable to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For hereunto ye are called: for Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an example that ye should follow his steps,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who did no sin, neither was there guile found in his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who when he was reviled, reviled not again: when he suffered, he threatened not, but committed it to him that judgeth righteously.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who his own self bare our sins in his body on the tree, that we being dead to sin, should live in righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye were as sheep going astray: but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise let the wives be subject to their husbands, that even they which obey not the word, may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they behold your pure conversation which is with fear:
speaker: Narrator

text: Whose appareling let it not be that outward, with braided hair, and gold put about, or in putting on of apparel:
speaker: Narrator

text: But let it be the hidden man of the heart, which consisteth in the incorruption of a meek and quiet spirit, which is before God a thing much set by.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even after this manner in time past did the holy women, which trusted in God, tire themselves, and were subject to their husbands.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Sarah obeyed Abraham, and called him Sir: whose daughters ye are, while ye do well, not being afraid of any terror.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise ye husbands, dwell with them as men of knowledge, giving honor unto the woman, as unto the weaker vessel, even as they which are heirs together of the grace of life, that your prayers be not interrupted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, be ye all of one mind: one suffer with another: love as brethren: be pitiful, be courteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not rendering evil for evil, neither rebuke for rebuke: but contrariwise bless, knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should be heirs of blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if any man long after life, and to see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let him eschew evil and do good: let him seek peace and follow after it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the eyes of the Lord are over the righteous, and his ears are open unto their prayers: and the face of the Lord is against them that do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And who is it that will harm you, if ye follow that which is good?
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding blessed are ye, if ye suffer for righteousness’ sake. Yea, fear not their fear, neither be troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you, with meekness and reverence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having a good conscience, that when they speak evil of you as of evil doers, they may be ashamed which slander your good conversation in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is better (if the will of God be so) that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, and was put to death concerning the flesh, but was quickened by the spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the which he also went, and preached unto the spirits that are in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which were in time passed disobedient, when once the long suffering of God abode in the days of Noah, while the Ark was preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved in the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whereof the baptism that now is, answering that figure, (which is not a putting away of the filth of the flesh, but a confident demanding with a good conscience maketh to God) saveth us also by the resurrection of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which is at the right hand of God, gone into heaven, to whom the Angels, and Powers, and might are subject.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forasmuch then as Christ hath suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind, which is, that he which hath suffered in the flesh, hath ceased from sin,
speaker: Narrator

text: That he hence forward should live (as much time as remaineth in the flesh) not after the lusts of men, but after the will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is sufficient for us that we have spent the time past of the life, after the lust of the Gentiles walking in wantonness, lusts, drunkenness, in gluttony, drinkings, and in abominable idolatries.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherein it seemeth to them strange, that ye run not with them unto the same excess of riot: therefore speak they evil of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which shall give account to him, that is ready to judge quick and dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For unto this purpose was the Gospel preached also unto the dead, that they might be condemned according to men in the flesh, but might live according to God in the spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the end of all things is at hand. Be ye therefore sober, and watching in prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: But above all things have fervent love among you: for love shall cover the multitude of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye harberous one to another, without grudging.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let every man as he hath received the gift, minister the same one to another, as good disposers of the manifold grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any man speak, let him speak as the words of God. If any man minister, let him do it as of the ability which God ministereth, that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom is praise and dominion forever, and ever, Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dearly beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial, which is among you to prove you as though some strange thing were come unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ’s sufferings, that when his glory shall appear, ye may be glad and rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye be railed upon for the Name of Christ, blessed are ye: for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you: which on their part is evil spoken of, but on your part is glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer, or as a thief, or an evil doer, or as a busybody in other men’s matters.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if any man suffer as a Christian, let him not be ashamed: but let him glorify God in this behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the time is come that judgment must begin at the house of God. If it first begin at us, what shall the end be of them which obey not the Gospel of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the righteous scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore let them that suffer according to the will of God, commit their souls to him in well doing, as unto a faithful Creator.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Elders which are among you, I beseech which am also an Elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed,
speaker: Narrator

text: Feed the flock of God, which dependeth upon you, caring for it not by constraint, but willingly: not for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind:
speaker: Narrator

text: Not as though ye were Lords over God’s heritage, but that ye may be examples to the flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when that chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive an incorruptible crown of glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise ye younger submit yourselves unto the Elders, and submit yourselves every man, one to another: deck yourselves inwardly in lowliness of mind: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast all your care on him: for he careth for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be sober, and watch: for your adversary the devil as a roaring lion walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom resist steadfast in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brethren which are in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the God of all grace, which hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a little, make you perfect, confirm, strengthen, and establish you.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him be glory and dominion forever and ever, Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Silvanus a faithful brother unto you, as I suppose, have I written briefly, exhorting and testifying how that this is the true grace of God, wherein ye stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Church that is at Babylon elected together with you, saluteth you, and Mark my son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet ye one another with the kiss of love. Peace be with you all which are in Christ Jesus, Amen.
speaker: Narrator
